string-array.name: indicator_salinity
string-array.item: Indicates the salinity level of soil and its impact on plant growth.
Increased soil salinity may lead to poor water absorption and plant growth cessation.
Use salt-tolerant crops, improve drainage, avoid saline water.

string-array.name: indicator_sfi
string-array.item: A measure of the soil’s fertility and its ability to support plant growth.
Low SFI indicates a deficiency in essential nutrients.
Add fertilizers and rotate crops for long-term improvement.

string-array.name: indicator_ndmi
string-array.item: Normalized Difference Moisture Index for detecting drought or excess moisture.
Low NDMI indicates drought; high indicates excess moisture.
Use drip irrigation or improve drainage depending on condition.

string-array.name: indicator_ser
string-array.item: Represents the soil\'s vulnerability to erosion by wind or water.
High erosion risk reduces fertility and complicates planting.
Use contour farming, windbreaks, or cover crops.
moderate slope, arid or near water

string-array.name: indicator_vhi
string-array.item: Measures plant health and vitality based on vegetation signals.
Low VHI reflects plant stress or nutrient deficiency.
Monitor soil/irrigation and use appropriate fertilization.

string-array.name: indicator_sdl
string-array.item: Indicates how deep the soil is for root growth.
Shallow soil restricts root growth and nutrient absorption.
Grow shallow-root crops, improve depth with organic matter.
lettuce, radish, onion, cabbage (shallow), corn, potatoes, sugar cane (deep)

string-array.name: indicator_lst
string-array.item: Reflects the surface temperature\'s effect on crops.
High temperatures cause stress and reduce crop growth.
Use drip irrigation and plant heat-tolerant crops.
corn, flax, winter wheat (hot), tomatoes, potatoes (moderate)

string-array.name: indicator_sti
string-array.item: Describes soil structure, drainage, and water retention.
Too sandy loses nutrients, too clayey holds water excessively.
Mix with compost or sand based on texture type.
tomatoes, potatoes, wheat (balanced), carrots, onions, peanuts (sandy), rice, sugarcane (clayey)

string-array.name: indicator_savi
string-array.item: Measures vegetation cover adjusted for soil reflection.
Low SAVI means weak vegetation or visible bare soil.
Grow dense vegetation crops and irrigate properly.
corn, alfalfa, sunflower (high), prickly pear, barley (low)

string-array.name: indicator_ndsi
string-array.item: Assesses snow cover or moisture potential.
Low NDSI indicates dry soil or water scarcity.
Use water-saving techniques or search alternative water sources.
olives, figs, barley (drought-resistance), others after snowmelt
spring after snow or adjust based on dryness
